member.name: P:MonoDevelop.Debugger.DebuggingService.SessionManager.SessionError
member.summary: Indicates whether the debug session failed to an exception or any debugger operation failed and was reported to the user.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.DebuggingService.SessionManager.PrepareForRun
member.summary: Called just before DebugSession.Run is called.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.DebuggingService.GetCurrentVisibleFrame
member.summary: The deepest stack frame with source above the CurrentFrame

member.name: P:MonoDevelop.Debugger.ValueVisualizer.Name
member.remarks: This name is shown in a combo box at the top of the visualizer dialog when there is more than one visualizer available for a value

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.ValueVisualizer.CanVisualize(Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance can visualize the specified value
member.returns: true if this instance can visualize the specified value; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method must check the value and return true if it is able to display that value. Typically, this method will check the TypeName of the value.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.ValueVisualizer.IsDefaultVisualizer(Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance is the default visualizer for the specified value
member.returns: true if this instance is the default visualizer for the specified value; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The default visualizer will be selected by default in the visualizer dialog

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.ValueVisualizer.GetVisualizerWidget(Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue)
member.summary: Gets a visualizer widget for a value
member.remarks: This method is called to get a widget for displaying the specified value. The method should create the widget and load the required information from the value. Notice that the ObjectValue.Value property returns a string representation of the value. If the visualizer needs to get values from the object properties, it can use the ObjectValue.GetRawValue method.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.ValueVisualizer.StoreValue(Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue)
member.summary: Saves changes done in the visualizer
member.returns: true if the changes could be saved
member.param: The value on which to store changes
member.remarks: This method is called to save changes done in the visualizer. The implementation should use ObjectValue.SetRawValue to store the changes. This method is only called if CanEdit returns true.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.ValueVisualizer.CanEdit(Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance supports editing the specified value
member.returns: true if this instance can edit the specified value; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method is called to determine if this visualizer supports value editing, in addition to visualization. The method is called only if CanVisualize returns true for the value, and if the value doesn't have the ReadOnly flag. Editing support is optional. The default implementation returns false.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.DebuggerEngineBackend.IsDefaultDebugger(MonoDevelop.Core.Execution.ExecutionCommand)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance is default debugger for the provided command

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.DebuggerEngineBackend.GetProcessAttacher
member.summary: has two advantages over : 1) it gives debugger engine ability to update processes list as soon as it discovers new processes via 2) it gives debugger engine lifetime information via , so debugger engine can clean resources used to look for processes e.g. loop thread, sockets...
member.remarks: If this method returns valid , won't be called.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.InlineVisualizer.CanInlineVisualize(Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance can inline visualize the specified value
member.returns: true if this instance can inline visualize the specified value; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method must check the value and return true if it is able to display that value. Typically, this method will check the TypeName of the value.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.InlineVisualizer.InlineVisualize(Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue)
member.summary: Converts specified value into string to be displayed in debugger.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.PreviewVisualizer.CanVisualize(Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance can visualize the specified value
member.returns: true if this instance can visualize the specified value; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method must check the value and return true if it is able to display that value. Typically, this method will check the TypeName of the value.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.PreviewVisualizer.GetVisualizerWidget(Mono.Debugging.Client.ObjectValue)
member.summary: Gets a visualizer widget for a value
member.remarks: This method is called to get a widget for displaying the specified value. The method should create the widget and load the required information from the value. Notice that the ObjectValue.Value property returns a string representation of the value. If the visualizer needs to get values from the object properties, it can use the ObjectValue.GetRawValue method.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.SourceCodeLookup.FindSourceFile(MonoDevelop.Core.FilePath,System.Byte[])
member.param: Hash of original file stored in .mdb/.pdb.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.Debugger.SourceCodeLookup.AddLoadedFile(MonoDevelop.Core.FilePath,MonoDevelop.Core.FilePath)
member.summary: Call this method when user succesfully opens file so we can reuse this path for other files from same project. Notice that it's caller job to verify hash matches for performance reasons.
